|                                                                         |   - Factors to consider:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - What is at stake                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - Consequences if patient is not treated                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - Expected outcome                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - Risks: probability and severity                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - Alternatives                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         | <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         | - Doctor is not expected to guarantee understanding the risks; but if doctor knows patient fails to comprehend, needs to do more.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         | <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         | - How to establish causal link?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |   - **"But for" causation:** "But for the negligent nondisclosure, I wouldn't have undergone the procedure; the procedure caused this injury; therefore, the negligent nondisclosure caused my injury."                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| HYPOOOOO                                                                | **The doctor does not disclose that he has alcohol abuse; but the doctor DOES disclose that there is a risk of incontinence. The plaintiff undergoes the surgery and experiences incontinence after the surgery. The plaintiff has no evidence that the alcohol abuse caused the incontinence, but sues, arguing that the failure to disclose the alcohol abuse caused the incontinence.**                                                                           |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         | - This could be argued either way! Depends on whether you see it more as battery or negligence. **[JURISDICTIONS SPLIT.]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |   - **THEORY 1: BUT-FOR CAUSE!** Right of choice! Recover for anything because would not have consented! (Medical battery)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - You should have a choice about whether you want to undergo a procedure with a doctor with alcoholism. The plaintiff should be able to recover from ANY effects because if the plaintiff had learned, they would not have consented to the surgery.                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - This is logic of medical battery cases. REGARDLESS of whether the treatment met a certain standard, you impoverished the plaintiff's right to CHOOSE.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |   - **THEORY 2: Proximate cause!** The incontinence needs to be CONNECTED to the risk that was not disclosed.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - Is there any connection between incontinence and alcohol abuse? Here, no.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                         |     - Only fair to match injury to the type of risk that was taken.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### Statutes and Regulations

+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Â§ 14 Statutory Violations as Negligence Per Se**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| The final way to establish what the reasonable person will do: Legislatures set a standard of care, and failure to meet that care can be negligence per se                                                                                                                                                                              |

| An actor is negligent if: **without excuse, the actor violates a statute that is designed to protect**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| (1) **against the type of accident the actor\'s conduct causes, and**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| (2) **if the accident victim is within the class of persons the statute is designed to protect.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                               | - Hypo re car crossing line and hitting car that should not be in left lane ðŸ¡ª rule designed to protect people hitting from behind, not head on, so does not qualify                                                                                     |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - We live in a statute-ified world! Especially from the turn of the century.                                                                                                                                                                            |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***When is there civil liability from statute violation?***                   | A.  Statutory causes of action (not our concern in this class)                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     (1) **Explicit** private causes of actions, meant to empower individuals to enforce the statutory regime                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     (2) **Implicit** private cause action, like constitutional wrongs and remedies                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | B.  Common Law Torts Negligence Claims: Defendant breached a common law duty of care                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     (1) The statute comes into play when the plaintiff is seeking to establish breach, the same way that cost-benefit or custom can be a way for the plaintiff to show that the defendant was negligent                                                 |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     (2) In these cases, there is a statutory violation that the plaintiff points to as evidence of negligence *per se,* in and of itself                                                                                                                |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |         (a) Statutory violation being used to undergird the common law claim                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |         (b) Just like custom, but custom is now a statute, and just like a breach of custom can be the basis of a negligence claim, a breach of statute can be negligence *per se*                                                                      |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |             (i) Negligence per se establishes a prima facie breach; normal negligence is simply evidence of a breach                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |                 1.  Negligence *per se* through a statutory violation is not necessary but it can be sufficient                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     (3) Distinguish between situations where the violation is negligence *per se* and those where the evidence of the statute violation is relevant but not determinative                                                                               |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Martin v. Herzog***                                                        | **Wrong lane crashes, no headlight: Both violated statutes. Cardozo: PL's violation is negligence per se.**                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| *(unlit buggy death; Cardozo)*                                                | **Facts:** P & husband driving in headlight-less buggy and killed by vehicle in wrong lane, which was in violation of statute                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | 1)  Wrong side of road (defendant's conduct) = violation of statute                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | 2)  No headlights (plaintiff's conduct) = violation of statute                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | **Trial Court:** The plaintiff's statutory violation is evidence of negligence, but not negligence *per se.*                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | **Cardozo Holding:** Violation of statute is negligence per se (in and of itself)                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - A statutory violation is negligence *per se!*                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - Cardozo's belief in legislative supremacy -- the legislature has set the standard of performance!                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - **The legislature set standard regarding highway safety...so this injury was exactly the type of harm directly contemplated by the standard!** (compare to the misalignment in *Gorris v. Scott)*                                                   |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - Cardozo is a judicial progressive, part of the shift in the early 20^th^ century towards deference to legislatures in terms of their **democratic features** and **expertise**                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - **Juries cannot relax duty owed by statute**                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - "A statute designed for the protection for human life is not to be brushed aside as a form of words, its commands reduced to the level of cautions, and the duty to obey attenuated into an option to conform." (Common law cannot evade statutes!) |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Recent change in baselines in the 20^th^ century                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Progressive performers fought very hard to get these laws on the books                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     - This would be a big blow to the activists and reformers who tried to get some degree of protection                                                                                                                                                |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Gorris v. Scott*** (drowning sheep): Overbaahhd                            | **Facts:** P contracted w/ D to carry sheep, but sheep washed overboard. Sheep were held in pens that violated Contagious Disease Act (Sheep shipper kept sheep together rather than separate, violating a law of sanitation).                          |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | **Holding:** Act had nothing to do with sheep falling overboard ðŸ¡ª finding for D.                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - **Because law protects against different type of accident (disease, not washing overboard), DF has no negligence per se.**                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - Need a fit between the harm that happened and the harm that the statute is designed to protect against!!!                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Lawyers try to argue that the statute is designed to protect at a high level of abstraction...But it's not a general sheep welfare act lol. It's about disease specifically.                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - DF can still be negligence for other reasons (e.g. reasonable person).                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                               +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                               | If the Restatement applied here:                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | 1.  **against the type of accident the actor\'s conduct causes** \[FAILS THIS PRONG -- DESIGNED TO PROTECT DISEASE NOT MARITIME ISSUE\]                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | 2.  **AND if the accident victim is within the class of persons the statute is designed to protect.** \[PROBABLY FAILS THIS PRONG TOO -- NOT DESIGNED TO PROTECT OWNERS FROM MARITIME ACCIDENTS\]                                                       |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***How do we respect legislatures?***                                         | Cardozo: We need to respect legislatures                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - Alignment/fit requirement: RST: (1) INTENDED TYPE OF HARM; (2) INTENDED CLASS OF VICTIMS                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Disease protection vs. maritime accidents                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - How can we reconcile this fit requirement with respecting legislatures? Why is this fit requirement MORE respectful of legislatures?                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Because it is thinking about the legislatures' intent                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Don't want every single statutory violation to be in and of itself and basis of a negligence claim -- not what they intended                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - These RST requirements tether negligence to what the legislature was TRYING to do                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - But what about law and order, and anarchy? If we don't treat these violations as negligence *per se,* is that letting people get away with wrongful conduct?                                                                                          |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - But: If you can't get negligence this way, you are not barred making a negligence claim.                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Statute violation is just one way of proving breach. Can still prove breach through other venues:                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     - If no negligence *per se...*try                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |       - Reasonable person standard                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

|                                                                               |     (b) **if the accident victim is within the class of persons the statute is designed to protect.**                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |

+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Negligence Per Se***                                                       | When a statutory violation occurs and the two prongs of the restatement are satisfied:                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | \(1\) type of accident as the statute was designed to protect and                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | \(2\) type of victim as statute was designed to protect                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | = NEGLIGENT PER SE = BREACH PER SE = DEFENDANT WAS NEGLIGENT PER SE                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| (1) **An excused violation of a legislative enactment or an administrative regulation is not negligence. \[AKA BREACH\]**                                                                                                                                                                                                               |

| (2) [Unless the enactment or regulation is construed not to permit such excuse, its violation is excused when]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

| <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

| (a) **the violation is reasonable because of the actor\'s incapacity;**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

| ***Tedla v. Ellman***                                                         | **PL did not face traffic, and thereby violated statute designed for safety. However, walking on the other side of the road would be more dangerous because of traffic. So, no contributory negligence.**                                               |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
| (garbage collector hit by truck from behind):                                 | **Facts:** P and disabled brother (deaf) were walking in direction of traffic on highway as heavy traffic going other way.                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - They are walking on the side with fewer cars. But the statute required pedestrians *face* traffic                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - A negligent driver hits them. P was injured and the brother died. D claims contributory negligence.                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | **Problem:** Fairness intuition -- they were acting with care by walking on the side with less traffic! How do we reconcile that with the statute?                                                                                                      |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | **Holding:** A STATUTORY VIOLATION CAN BE EXCUSED FOR PURPOSES OF LIABILITY WHEN IT WOULD CAUSE GREATER HARM -- TODAY, SEE RESTATEMENT Â§288A (2)(e)                                                                                                     |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - This statute enacted to codify customary practice around road safety.                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - **Different from *Martin v. Herzog,* which was layering on additional safeguards (not codifying custom through statute)**                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - **Here, the legislature is using a statute to codify pre-existing common law understandings, and this is a conflict between pre-existing common law understandings and a statutory violation**                                                      |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     - Defendants: Plaintiff is contributorily negligent because they violated the statute by walking with the flow of statute as opposed to against the grain                                                                                           |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     - But if that statutory standard did not exist and the behavior was measured purely against the common law understanding, that very same behavior would be understood as NOT negligent                                                              |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     - So: Tension between common-law understandings and the common law                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |     - Lehman: Task is to reconcile this tension                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - LEHMAN: We need to interpret statute in a way that harmonizes common law with the goal of the statute, since they are being careful!                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - Can try to harmonize common law with statute if doing so advances the purpose of the statute rather than frustrating it!! (*raises judicial and institutional role questions)*                                                                        |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - There is a common law custom to allow exception to walking facing traffic if it is safer due to fewer cars other way                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               |   - Statute doesn\'t account for car volume, so common law creates statutory exception                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                               | - Common law has an exception for if there are fewer cars going beside you, since that would make walking along with traffic SAFER                                                                                                                      |

Rebuttable presumption now: There is a duty of care in all circumstances.

WITHOUT Res Ipsa Loquitor doctrine -- must find a cannister or some other evidence that the oil is the fault of the neighbor                                                                                                                                                                                             |

|                                                                                                                                     | 2. |                                                                                                                                     |     i)  STILL not going to suffice that it just HAPPENED                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |     ii) Still have to come up with more evidence to buttress the case                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |     iii) **Normally, as a general rule, proof that the accident happened, WITHOUT proof that the defendant's specific conduct caused it, is NOT enough to sustain a negligence charge.**                                                                                                                                     |

|                                                                                                                                     |          (1) SO why have res ipsa?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |              (a) Res ipsa merely says that in a select group of circumstances, a jury may infer the defendant's negligence based on the mere fact that the accident happened.                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |              (b) The entire ballgame is determining what are the select group of circumstances where the mere fact of occurring sustains negligence.                                                                                                                                                                         |
