| **RES IPSA:** [3 factor standard for circumstances where res ipsa loquitor satisfies burden of production \[**USE THIS *GRAJALES/PROSSER KEETON* STANDARD\]**]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| 1)  **Accident of a kind which ordinarily doesn\'t occur in absence of negligence** *(easy)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| 2)  **Accident caused by agency or instrumentality within exclusive control of D *\[FLEXIBLE/EXPANSIVE READING IF MULTIPLE DEFENDANTS -- if nobody can prove it wasn't them, all are liable (Ybarra)\]***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| 3)  **Accident not due to voluntary action by P \[*Not brute force causation -- whether it is BLAMEWORTHY* (*Grajales)\]***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - ***Grajales**: American argued that the plaintiff took the "voluntary action" of leaning on the countertop*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| - *But the test is not whether plaintiff took any voluntary action - it is whether that voluntary action can be BLAMED for the accident.*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Procedural Effects of Res Ipsa***                                                                                                | - Starting situation: Screwed plaintiff with only circumstantial evidence                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     | - The burden of production in a res ipsa case is very difficult for plaintiffs because the evidence is not there                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |   - Usually, in the absence of evidence, you cannot draw inference in favor of the plaintiff                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     | - Res Ipsa makes it permissible under these circumstances to infer negligence in the absence of direct evidence                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |   - The jury MAY infer possible negligence under these circumstances                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |   - Allows you to meet the burden of production to get past a MTD                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                     |   - But does not mean that the plaintiff has satisfied the ultimate burden of persuasion                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| [**RST (2nd) Â§328D Res Ipsa Loquitur:** It may be inferred that harm suffered by the plaintiff is caused by negligence of the defendant when:]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| (c) **the indicated negligence is within the scope of the defendant\'s duty to the plaintiff.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| **[RST (3d.) Â§ 17 Res Ipsa Loquitur]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| The factfinder may infer that the defendant has been negligent when the accident causing the plaintiff\'s harm is a **type of accident that ordinarily happens as a result of the negligence of a class of actor**s of which **the defendant is the relevant member**.                                                                                                                                                                                             |

| Roadmap of Plaintiff's Conduct                                                                                                                                                                    |
+=====================================================================+=============================================================================================================================+
| - Contributory negligence involves the same tools that we use to assess the defendants' conduct to now assess the plaintiff's conduct.                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - Did the plaintiff's conduct fall below the standard that the plaintiff **owes to themselves** for their own safety and protection?                                                              |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 1.  **Contributory Negligence &**                                   | 1)  Plaintiff's behavior falls below the standard of care to which he should conform for his own protection, and            |
|                                                                     |                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                     | 2)  Is a legally contributing cause co- operating w/ the negligence of the defendant in bringing abt the plaintiff\'s harm. |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 2.  **Comparative Negligence**                                      | - Plaintiff's contribution to the harm should not ENTIRELY bar recovery because that is way too harsh                       |
|                                                                     |                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                     | <!-- -->                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                     |                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                     | - Reduce liability in accordance with the harm or responsibility that you bear                                              |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 3.  **Assumption of Risk**                                          | - Plaintiff has knowingly and voluntarily taken on a risk -- implied or express                                             |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### 1. Contributory Negligence

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Contributory Negligence                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| Policy arguments for contributory negligence                          | 1.  **Justice:** liability follows fault, so limit recovery if P also at fault                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | 2.  **Incentives:** do not reward carelessness, incentivize the carefulness!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | 3.  **Causation:** If P also negligent, causation is weaker                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | 4.  **Public policy/Administrability:** too tricky to mete out exact justice in these cases                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | 5.  **PROSSER CRITIQUE -- LIKE THE SUBSITY THESIS:** The period of development of contributory negligence was that of the industrial revolution, and there is reason to think that the court found in this defense, along with the concepts off duty and proximate cause, a convenient instrument of control over the jury, by which the liabilities of rabidly growing industry were curbed and kept within bounds |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       |     i)  A plaintiff's own negligence generally barred a plaintiff's recovery. If BOTH defendant AND PLAINTIFF were negligent, it cancels out and plaintiff gets nothing.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Â§ 463 Contributory Negligence Defined \[**the old harsh approach\]**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Contributory negligence is conduct on the part of the plaintiff which:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| 1)  **falls below the standard of care to which he should conform for his own protection, and**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| 2)  **which is a legally contributing cause co- operating with the negligence of the defendant in bringing about the plaintiff\'s harm.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Butterfield v. Forrester***                                        | [Horse tripped on pole: If PL is contributorily negligent, DF is not liable.]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | **Facts:** P rode horse fast in semi-dark and ran into pole D had left across rode, hurting P.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | **Holding:** P should have seen the obstruction and used ordinary caution ðŸ¡ª since no due care, P is contributorily negligent                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                       | - ONLY do affirmative contributory negligence analysis in places where it's obvious or needed                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Symmetry btw plaintiff and defendant!***                           | If there's a plausible contributory negligence claim, apply the same negligence standard (BREACH & CAUSATION) to the PLAINTIFF instead of the defendant.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### 2. Comparative Negligence

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Comparative Negligence:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| RESPONSE to the harsh results of a complete bar from Contributory Negligence (Kind of a variation)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

| [R3D Â§ 7 Effect of Plaintiff\'s Negligence \[*read as the pure form of comparative negligence\]*]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Plaintiff\'s negligence (or the negligence of another person for whose negligence the plaintiff is responsible) that is a legal cause of **an indivisible injury** to the plaintiff **reduces the plaintiff\'s recovery in proportion to the share of responsibility** the factfinder assigns to the plaintiff (or other person for whose negligence the plaintiff is responsible).                                             |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Divisible injury:**                                                                                                         | **Possible to allocate causal responsibility.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               | - E.g. A and B are driving their cars and collide at an intersection, owing to A's negligence. Both injured. B then goes to Dr. C to treat the injuries from the collision. C is negligent. This negligent treatment results in an infection to the existing wound and B suffers some more.     |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               |   - A's negligence caused the injury from the car crash. C's negligence caused the injury from the infection. DIVISIBLE.                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               | - Consider the relationship between PL & D1 \[including comparative negligence\], PL & D2 \[including comparative negligence\] **separately.**                                                                                                                                                  |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Indivisible injury:**                                                                                                       | **The task of allocating causal responsibility among the defendants is not possible**                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               | - Plaintiff and each relevant person caused the injury: EACH caused the injury in some way                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               |   - E.g. two cars crash and injure passerby.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               | <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                               | - Calculate everybody's negligence together.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| N.B.: first analyze whether PL is negligent at all. Use reasonable person standard, BPL, custom, statutes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [Pure v. 50 percent]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **[Pure form (51% Rule):]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | **[50 percent rule:]{.underline}**                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                |
| **[DECREASE RECOVERY BY PROPORTION OF FAULT]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                     | **[PURE FORM UNTIL 50%; THEN NO RECOVERY IF 50% FAULT OR MORE]{.underline}**                                                                   |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Even if PL was 70% at fault, PL was still injured so can recover 30%                                                                                                                                                                                                           | **VARIATION 1:** PL's fault is more than 50% = no recovery; PL's fault is less than **or equal to** 50% = recovery is proportionate            |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                +------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | **VARIATION 2:** PL's fault is more than **or equal to** 50% = no recovery; PL's fault is less than 50% = recovery is proportionate            |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                | Unfair to plaintiffs on the margins -- leads to many appeals                                                                                   |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Li v. Yellow Cab** (California car crash):*                                                                                | **Facts:** DF ran yellow light and hit PL's car, but PL was taking a U turn despite traffic. (P crossed three lanes of traffic; hit by speeding D.)                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

|                                                                                                                               |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

|                                                                                                                               +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

Ellman?*                            |
