### 3. Assumption of Risk 

+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Assumption of Risk:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| Assuming risk of harm bars victim from recovery.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| **Assumption of Risk:** When P voluntarily consents, implied or expressly, to take their chances of harm occurring they are barred from recovery                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - Why should the court award damages to a person who has voluntarily taken this chance? (Similar to consent for intentional torts)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - **Conceptually, resembles the 19^th^-century doctrine of the fellow servant rule**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|   - Workers in the pre-worker-compensation era assumed the risk of the work if which they were engaged                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|     - [SUBSIDY THESIS ARGUMENT]{.underline}: Shift to negligence was meant to aid incipient industry in a fledgling capitalist economy                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|     - [NEOCLASSICAL ARGUMENT]{.underline}: Cheapest cost avoider theory; risk that you are taking on is translated into higher wages in bargaining                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|       - Lochnerian context -- freedom of contract era                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|         - To use tort law to interfere in such bargaining was arguably paternalistic and inappropriate                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|   - Eventually abolished (since it systematically disadvantaged workers) and transitioned into a worker's comp system                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|   - But the doctrine expanded into assumption of risk and broader concepts                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| - **RST on Assumption of Risk:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|   - Except when person expressly agrees, they do not assume risk of harm from D\'s conduct unless they knew of the risk and appreciated its unreasonable character                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|     - Subjective standard -- *does* P in fact see, know, and understand/appreciate the risk?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|     - Testimony not always believed ðŸ¡ª some risks that no adult will be believed not to have understood                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [***Implied Assumption of Risk*** Â§496C]{.underline} -- \[SUBJECTIVE STANDARD -- *THAT* PLAINTIFF MUST SUBJECTIVELY APPRECIATE IT\]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| . . . \[A\] plaintiff **who fully understands a risk of harm to himself...**caused by the defendant\'s conduct or by the condition of the defendant\'s land or chattels, and **who nevertheless voluntarily chooses to enter or remain...**within the area of that risk, under circumstances that **manifest his willingness to accept it, is not entitled to recover** for harm within that risk.                   |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Assumption of risk? NO recovery for harm**                                                                                       | - P fully understands a risk caused by D\'s conduct or the condition of their land/property and nevertheless chooses to enter/remain with a manifest acceptance                                                                                                                 |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Murphy v. Steeplechase***                                                                                                       | **Facts:** Flopper at Coney Island knocks people into padded walls and floor. P and friends observed, voluntarily got in, and were injured. They sued for negligence.                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| *(the flopper):*                                                                                                                   | **Holding (Cardozo):** [Volenti non fit injuria -- to a willing person no injury is done.]{.underline} If you take part in a sport, you accept the obvious and necessary dangers. THE TIMOROUS MAY STAY AT HOME :o                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - The risks (falling on a speedy and jerky flopper) were obvious, and not unreasonably high. PL assumed the risk.                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Example of primary assumption of risk ðŸ¡ª D did nothing wrong                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - But: Plaintiff may have anticipated falling, but not falling *that* hard! Must feel confident that plaintiff knew what he was in for.                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - Cardozo: Mishmash of assumption of risk & inadequate proof of negligence                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                    +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                    | **RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN DEFENDANT'S LACK OF NEGLIGENCE & PLAINTIFF'S ASSUMPTION OF RISK**                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Sometimes, these are distinct questions to be analyzed separately                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - e.g., the condition of the ride was poorly maintained (negligence)                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - e.g., was this plaintiff fully aware of the risks (assumption of risk)                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Sometimes these are the same                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Exceptions ***(Murphy)***                                                                                                          | 1)  **Danger is hidden or obscure** (e.g., invisible deterioration of the ride equipment)                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | 2)  **Risk is so high that the activity is inherently too dangerous** (e.g., too many people are getting injured!!)                                                                                                                                                             |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Difference between AR and contributory negligence**                                                                              | - In AR, P\'s conduct is NOT negligent (we run risks everyday -- nothing NEGLIGENT about going on the flopper)                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - There is a subjective inquiry in AR, but an objective one in contributory negligence                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - D creates the risk in AR that P accepts                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Maddox v. NYC** (Yankee player):*                                                                                               | **Facts:** PL is professional baseball player. On a rainy day, his foot was stuck in mud and thus injured his knee by slipping in a wet spot. He sued stadium for poor drainage system                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | **Holding:** Player traditionally assumes risk. He knew the field was muddy but did not complain or refuse to play.                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Professionals in a professional context can be imputed a degree of awareness and knowledge about common dangers ðŸ¡ª player knew there was mud and made a choice and no trier of fact could find otherwise so no jury                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - No evidence that he was compelled to play.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Landings Ass'n (alligator):***                                                                                                  | **Facts:** Old lady knew there were alligators in the neighborhood, went out at night and was killed. She went for walk in development at night and was eaten by a gator. There was a policy to remove gators above a certain length and this one was above that length.        |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | **Holding:** PL either knowingly assumed the risks or failed to exercise ordinary care, so case dismissed.                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - P knowingly assumed the risk of walking in the area, so no collection.                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                    +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                    | **Notes:** This case gets it wrong in not considering comparative negligence.                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Since there is secondary AR and FL is a comparative negligence, which would allow P to collect based on proportion of risk                                                                                                                                                    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Primary Assumption of Risk:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | **Secondary Assumption of Risk**                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                        |
| DF has no duty to PL at all (NEITHER AT FAULT; sports event)                                                                                                                                                                                                                | DF has duty of care and breaches it (BOTH AT FAULT; comparative negligence)                                                            |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Taking into account P\'s conduct, **D is NOT negligent -- no duty or did not breach**                                                                                                                                                                                       | In the face of **D\'s negligence**, **P knowingly encountered the risk**                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                        |
| - D did nothing wrong, so NO recovery                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       | - D DID do something wrong, but P encountered it knowingly                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                        |
| - *Murphy* case (the Flopper) and field hockey hypo (organized sports)                                                                                                                                                                                                      | - To proceed knowing D\'s negligence is negligence too                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | - Same fact pattern as contributory negligence ðŸ¡ª split based on jurisdiction for recovery                                              |

DF negligent, and PL assumed risk ðŸ¡ª analyze both.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| 2.  DF not negligent, and PL assumed risk ðŸ¡ª normal risky activity like skiing.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| 3.  DF negligent, and PL did not assumed risk ðŸ¡ª DF liable.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Assumption of Risk and COMPARATIVE /CONTRIBUTORY NEGLIGENCE                                                                        | - **When P consents to take an unreasonable chance there can be BOTH AR and contributory negligence ðŸ¡ª has to be secondary AR**                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - For AR we look for knowing/voluntary risk-taking, for CN we look for unreasonable/wrongful conduct                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - If AR but NOT CN, then it is primary AR ðŸ¡ª no negligence by D since they did not breach a duty and P consented                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - E.g., GETTING ON THE FLOPPER: no breach of duty by defendant, but plaintiff engaged voluntarily                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - If CN but not AR, then both sides are negligent (Li v. Yellow Cab)                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - E.g., Sofa falls off a pickup truck bc negligently tied on, but plaintiff negligently ran into it bc wasn't looking                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Most jurisdictions just use comparative negligence due to difficulty in deciding when collection should be allowed                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - **In primary AR P should get nothing**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - **In secondary AR there is a split based on jurisdiction**                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |     - **Comparative negligence jurisdiction will give some amount to P**                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |     - **Contributory negligence jurisdictions will give nothing to P**                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                    | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+    |
|                                                                                                                                    | | Assumption of risk                                                                                                                                                               | Contributory/Comparative negligence                                                   |    |
|                                                                                                                                    | +==================================================================================================================================================================================+=======================================================================================+    |
|                                                                                                                                    | | Possibly no one is at fault; the activity is risky, DF may not be negligent but they've created a risk (running a ski resort, etc.); PL assumed the risk.                        | **Both at fault:** DF is negligent, PL is also negligent**.**                         |    |
|                                                                                                                                    | |                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                       |    |
|                                                                                                                                    | | - Ask: Does it seem like the defendant has done something wrong? Is situation inherently risky?                                                                                  |                                                                                       |    |
|                                                                                                                                    | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+    |
|                                                                                                                                    | | Subjective analysis: Did THIS PL actually know (existence of danger) and appreciate (magnitude of danger) the risks of this inherently risky activity (Flopper, baseball, etc.)? | **Objective analysis:** Did PL act like a reasonable person under like circumstances? |    |
|                                                                                                                                    | +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [***Express Assumption of Risk*** Â§496b]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| A plaintiff who by contract or otherwise **expressly agrees to accept** a risk of harm arising from the defendant\'s negligent or reckless conduct cannot recover for such harm, **unless the agreement is invalid as contrary to public policy.**                                                                                                                                                                   |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                    | - P who by contract or otherwise express agreement accepts risk of harm from D\'s negligence                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Cannot recover for harm **UNLESS** void for ***public policy*** reasons                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Factors making agreements to assume risk invalid (CA SC):**                                                                      | 1)  Concerning business of type suitable for public regulation                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | 2)  D does service of great importance to public/perhaps necessity                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | 3)  **D performs service for essentially anyone seeking it**                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | 4)  Due to essential nature of service + economic transaction, D has decisive advantage in bargaining power                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | 5)  Transaction puts person or property of other party in control of seller + subject to risk of carelessness by seller/their agents                                                                                                                                            |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Dalury v. S-K-I Ltd.***                                                                                                         | **Facts:** P injured skiing but had signed an exculpatory agreement absolving D of liability. Is it void against public policy?                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ***(Skier collided with pole):***                                                                                                  | **Holding:** Contract void per public policy ðŸ¡ª business offers service to general public, so need to maintain a level of care                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Allowing them to avoid this contravenes public policy                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - **Policy argument:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   1.  **INCENTIVES**: If the defendants can use broad waivers, that removes an important incentive for managing risk                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   2.  **UTILITY:** good thing for fewer people to be injured                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   3.  **FAIRNESS:** don't put burden on the people least able to do anything about it                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | - Medical procedures, dangerous activities: assumption of risks through express contracts!                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    |   - **But *Dalury* says that there are times where public policy limits how much assumption of risk we allow**                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                    +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                    | Public policy factors, disjunctive test (Tunkl):                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | (1) Type of business suitable for public regulation;                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | (2) Service is of great importance to the public, practical necessity for some people;                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | (3) Party holds itself out as willing to perform service to the general public or at least people coming within certain standards;                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | (4) Decisive disparity of bargaining power;                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | (5) Standard cohesion contract with no provision for purchaser to obtain extra protection;                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | (6) Purchaser or her property is placed under control of the seller.                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                    | **Can get out of an exculpatory contract if these factors are met \^\^**                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

## CAUSATION

+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Causation Overview                                                                                                                                                                     |
+:=============================================================:+:======================================================================================================================:+
| P must establish ***[both]{.underline}*** But-For (Factual) and Proximate (Legal) causation in their prima facie case                                                                  |
+---------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
