| **Causation in Fact (But-for)**                               | **Proximate Cause (Legal):**                                                                                           |
+---------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| If X did not happen, Y would not have happened, so X caused Y | - X is sufficiently proximate or close cause of Y that public policy considerations warrant liability (FORESEEABILITY) |
|                                                               |                                                                                                                        |
|                                                               | - What harms are actually FAIRLY ATTRIBUTABLE to the defendant?                                                        |
+---------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Factual Inquiry                                               | Normative and Conceptual Inquiry                                                                                       |
|                                                               |                                                                                                                        |
|                                                               | (Fairness/Justice/Public Policy undercurrents)                                                                         |
+---------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### Factual Cause (But-For)

+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Factual Cause                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |

| [RST Â§ **26** Factual Cause \[counterfactual analysis\]]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| **Conduct is a factual cause of harm when the harm would not have occurred absent the conduct.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Counterfactual dependence:**                               | - Asserting a negligence claim: "You did X or failed to do X and that is negligent"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **More likely than not**                                     | - But-for causation inquiry: "If you had done X or not done X, things would have been different"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - Question: WHAT WOULD HAVE HAPPENED TO THE PLAINTIFF HAD THE DEFENDANT DONE X OR FAILED TO DO X?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - **BURDEN OF PROOF = PREPONDERANCE OF THE EVIDENCE (51%)**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - SO: IS IT **MORE LIKELY THAN NOT** THAT THINGS WOULD HAVE HAPPENED DIFFERENTLY?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                              +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              | - If, contrary to actual fact, X had not happened, then Y also would not have happened ðŸ¡ª thus, Y is counterfactually dependent on X                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | > **[RST comment e:]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - Req**.** that actor\'s tortious conduct be necessary for harm to occurs requires counterfactual injury: Asking what *would have occurred* w/o the conduct                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - Easy: Driver sleeping at wheel                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - Hard: Marginally more risky conduct than permitted or failure to do something that reduces risk with risk still existing absent negligence                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - \[NEGLIGENT CONDUCT CAN BE COMMISSION *OR* OMISSION OF AN ACT\]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Two-part test**                                            | 1)  Was D\'s conduct negligent *for the reason* that it increased a particular risk?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | 2)  Did that risk materialize?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - If yes, a trier of fact can infer negligent behavior caused the harm                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - Similar to negligence per se (statute intends to stop X, precisely X happens, therefore unexcused statutory violation = negligence per se)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - **AND THEN BURDEN SHIFTING:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - **Burden shifting** -- when there\'s a strong causal link, negligent party bears the burden of proof to deny but-for cause and suggest that wrongful conduct was not substantial cause                                                                                                                                                                                     |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***New York Central RR v. Grimstad***                        | [Facts]{.underline}**:** P, a barge captain, fell into water & drowned when a tug hit it. P\'s wife ran to save him but could not find a buoy and he died.                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| \(1920\)                                                     | [Holding:]{.underline} **No factual cause**. Not enough evidence that **but for the lack of buoy**, the man would have been saved.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **Barge Drowning, no BUT-FOR**                               | - Jury *cannot* conclude that D\'s negligence was more likely than not cause of P\'s death                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - No way to know she would have made it in time                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - If no reasonable person could conclude than more likely than not X is the cause, then D is not liable as a **matter of law**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                              +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              | Here, OMISSION of an act is negligent. In other places, it might be the COMMISSION of an act.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **What do you do if there is ONLY CIRCUMSTANTIAL EVIDENCE? Apply *Zuchowicz*.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***Zuchowicz v. US***                                  | **Facts:** P prescribed Doncrine by Naval Hospital at 2x dose and had serious side effects. P stopped drug but then got fatal primary pulmonary hypertension and got pregnant and died. Jury awarded \$1M                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **CIRCUMSTANTIAL**                                           | - Easy case for NEGLIGENCE PER SE \[BREACH\] (overprescribed, against the FDA guidelines)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **EVIDENCE**                                                 | **Holding - Judge Calabresi uses 2-part test:** 1) Was negligence the reason for an increase in a PARTICULAR risk, 2) did THAT risk occur?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| **STATUTORY VIOLATION**                                      | - In any given tort case, the burden of proof (production & persuasion) falls on the plaintiff.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| ##### (drug overdose, circumstantial evidence for causation) |   - (That evidentiary burden moved in "breach" land with *res ipsa loquitor.)* Something similar happens here.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - Same question here, for causation: **When can circumstantial evidence prove one element of negligence?**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - 1\. When the negligence creates a PARTICULAR RISK? (of an overdose)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - 2\. When THAT RISK happens.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | *STATUTORY/REGULATORY VIOLATION OF BASELINE ACCEPTABLE AND UNACCEPTABLE RISK LEVELS*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - *HERE:* FDA sets max doses to minimize side effects                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - [1) Was negligence the reason for an increase in a PARTICULAR risk?]{.underline} **YES: TWICE the dosage was prescribed!!**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - HYPO: What if only 10% over the regulation? Can do the test, but it's weaker.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - [2) Did THAT risk occur? **YES: OVERDOSE SYMPTOMS**]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - HYPO: What if there is an overdose, but the symptoms that come to pass are DIFFERENT than those predicted by the FDA? A tougher time satisfying the Zuchowicz test.                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - When a negative side effect is demonstrated to be the result of a drug and the drug was wrongly prescribed in unapproved/excessive amount, the injured P has shown enough to permit finder of fact to conclude excessive dose was substantial factor in producing harm                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - **The reason the FDA does not approve the approval of new drugs at above the doses as to which extensive tests have been performed is because all drugs involve risks of untoward side effects in those who take them. The negligence threshold is the over prescription threshold of FDA regulations, and what happened is exactly what the FDA predicted would happen.** |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - *MARTIN V. HERTZOG, too: (Calabresi cites)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - *Statute requires lights on cars. No lights, and an accident happened at night**. Exactly the risk you would expect** to happen!! So that satisfied but-for causation.*                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - *Then shifts to the defendant to prove that the act DIDN'T cause the accident.*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                              +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              | **[SIMILAR TYPES OF SITUATIONS -- TO ANALOGIZE]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - [Other drug overdoses]{.underline} -- circumstantial evidence, so it's hard to prove the causal chain OBVIOUSLY                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - BY CONTRAST, if a car hits you, there's pretty direct evidence and but-for causation is straightforward.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - [*Martin v. Hertzog:* The statute at issue in the case required buggies to have lights.]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - The inference is that the purpose of the statute is to prevent car accidents at night. The very thing that the statute was supposed to guard against occurs.                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - In fact patterns like this, where statutory or regulatory violations occur and the very type of harm transpires that the statute was designed to protect against conspires, that usually suffices for proving but-for causation.                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - [Requirements for landlords to light up stairwells so that people don't fall. Plaintiff falls.]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - 1\. Was negligence the reason for an increase in risk?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - **What does well-lit mean here? Easy if the statute requires a certain wattage. If not, probably go to CUSTOM.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |       - Did How well-lit was the stairwell? How well-lit were neighboring stairwells?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |       - Need 5 bulbs but only have 4? Probably okay. Need 5 but only have 1? Probably not.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - TO WORK THROUGH PRONG ONE OF ZUCHOWICZ TEST, GO TO CUSTOM AND OTHER TOOLS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |     - HARDER TO SATISFY PRONG ONE WHEN IT IS ONLY A SLIGHT DEVIATION:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |       - Easy when there is a 200% over-prescribing; HARDER when there is only a slight deviation from the statutory baseline                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                              +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              | **[Distinguish between two questions:]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | \(1\) whether prescribing **drug** caused death \[prescribing per se is not negligent\];                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | \(2\) whether prescribing **overdose** caused death.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              | **[When you want to prove causation but are dealing with probabilities, ask:]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | 1\) was negligence reason for increase in risk? \[yes, over-prescription\]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | 2\) did risk happen? \[yes, harms of over-prescription occurred\]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | **[Once this 2-part test is established, burden shifts to DEFENDANT to deny but-for causation (overdose did NOT cause the harm)]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                              +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              | - **Narrow lesson \[DRUG OVERDOSES\]:** proof structure for establishing factual causation in **drug overdose cases**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - (works particularly well when dose is super excessive ðŸ¡ª less convincing when the overdose is small, because it's harder to see how the jury could reasonably draw factual causation since the injury could have been caused by a normal dosage                                                                                                                             |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | - **Broad Lesson \[PROOF STRUCTURE FOR ANY SITUATION OF INFERRING FROM CIRCUMSTANTIAL EVIDENCE\]:** general proof structure for establishing factual causation from circumstantial evidence                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - Dimly lit staircase (more convincing the dimmer)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              |   - Absent lifeguard death, drownings still happen, but 1) negligent because increased drowning and 2) death                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Test:**                                                    | **[When direct evidence of causation is not available, can establish causation by circumstantial evidence.]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | When:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | 1.  Negligence raised risk of a particular type of accident, and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | 2.  This type of accident happened                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                              | Then, we have a rebuttable presumption that negligent act caused the harm.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                              |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
+--------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

#### 1. Multiple Causes

+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Multiple Sufficient Causes                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

| [RST Â§ 27 Multiple Sufficient Causes:]{.underline} MAKES SURE THAT ALL JOINT TORTFEASORS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR CAUSES OF THEIR OWN ACTION                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| If multiple acts occur, **each of which under Â§ 26 alone would have been a factual cause of the physical harm at the same time in the absence of the other act(s), each act is regarded as a factual cause of the harm.**                                                                                                                 |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **[If two tortfeasors cause plaintiff's harm, the law lets them both be on the hook for damages (but NOT twice as many damages).]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| - E.g., landlord is required by law to equip the building with smoke detectors but fails to do that. Neighbor negligently starts a fire. B, a tenant, is injured with lung damage when she inhales the smoke.                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|   - BOTH are liable for the injury. So who pays what? **Here, this is an indivisible injury, so joint & several liability.**                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| **[Two approaches:]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **INDIVISIBLE HARM: Joint & Several Liability**                                                                                                                                                                   | **DIVISIBLE HARM: Several Liability**                                                                                 |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **All negligent parties on hook for full amount. P chooses who to sue \[sue both\]**                                                                                                                              | **Court can find parties responsible for a certain proportion of the harm**                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                       |
| - Fair if injury is indivisible ðŸ¡ª harm cannot be separated into components                                                                                                                                        | - Each DF is responsible for a particular portion of damages, and neither has an obligation to pay the other's share. |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                       |
| - If indivisible harm and both parties are factual causes \[overdetermination\]: PL can collect the full compensation from either party. (Probably sue the one with DEEP POCKETS)                                 | - Accident 1 Injury can be separated from Accident 2 Injury                                                           |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***Kingston v. Chicago & NWR Co.***                                                 | **Facts:** Two fires, both human induced, are both factual causes. Two fires damaged P\'s property, one caused by train sparks, and other by unknown human. Fires merged and destroyed property, and jury found both were proximate cause.    |
|                                                                                           |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
| ##### **Two Fires**                                                                       | - Neither fire is a but-for cause here because the other fire exists! If the first fire didn't happen, the second fire would still burn it!                                                                                                   |
