|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - DF assumed the duty: he has a special relationship to PL for they are "companions on a social venture".                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - *Shoddy piece of reasoning to get to what they think is the moral right answer!!*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - It was costless...but under common law, even if the rescue is costless it shouldn't matter                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - Knew or should\'ve known no one would find him...sure, but should he have known that he would DIE?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - Not necessarily good law now                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **Policy reason:** Courts will find a duty where a reasonable person would want this duty                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### **B. TRANSACTIONAL RELATIONSHIPS/**                                                                                                                                            | **Kinds of special relationships that create a duty to take affirmative action:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| #####  **RELATIONSHIPS OF CONTROL**                                                                                                                                                  | 1.  **Common carriers**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ***Harper v. Herman***                                                                                                                                                               | 2.  **Innkeepers,**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ##### (boat diver)                                                                                                                                                                   | 3.  **Possessors of land who hold it open to the public**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | 4.  **Persons who have custody of another person under circumstances in which that other person is deprived of normal circumstances of self-protection**                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | There is a [transactional relationship]{.underline} or [relationship of control]{.underline} which raises expectations of care.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - PL limits own capacity of self-protection by putting themselves under D's control and is in a vulnerable position.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **Facts:** P guest on D\'s boat and dove into bad spot and was paralyzed. D knew about danger but didn\'t warn guests.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **Question:** Whether a boat owner who is a social host owes a duty of care to warn guests that the water is too shallow for diving.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - Originally, no duty. But was a special relationship created?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **Holding:** No. Knowing that action is necessary for another\'s protection is not enough for duty w/o special relationship. Harper had no reasonable expectation to look at Herman for protection, and Herman had no duty to warn Harper that the water was shallow.                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - In this case, no special relationship. PL is merely a guest on the boat.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - He is not particularly vulnerable and does not lack ability of self-protection.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - DF has no considerable power over him.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - DF has no financial gain from their relationship.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - No legal obligation to assist means no liability, no matter how clear the costlessness of the rescue and the costs of the likely injury.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **HYPO:** Taken boat out a mile from shore, farther than most people can swim. The weather turns stormy. Harper slips off the boat into the water. Herman has plenty of equipment to help save Harper, but Herman is distracted and does not. He drowns.                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - They are far from shore, so Harman represents the *only* way for Harper to safely get back to shore. An affirmative duty to intervene and help can be created here because of the special relationship/relationship of control.                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **HYPO:** A daycare is required to give medical care to a sick child -- custodial relationship creates special relationship.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | **HYPO:** Does *Farwell v. Keaton* work as a special relationship case??                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - Not really.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Farwell* and *Harper***                                                                                                                                                           | **[Stakes: Allocation of decisionmaking authority between judge and jury]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - The *Farwell* court treats the defendant's knowledge of the plaintiff's risky position as grounds for recognizing a special relationship.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - \[JURY\]: If the existence of duty turns on factual questions such as the defendant's knowledge of risks, then the JURY will have considerable influence on the duty determination                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - The *Harper* court, by contrast, seems to suggest that the fact of the defendant's knowledge is not a reason to recognize a duty to render assistance, but rather merely a reason to think that the defendant may have breached such a duty when a special relationship establishing such a duty can be said to exist for independent reason.                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - \[JUDGE\]: But if the duty determination, as in *Harper,* is made independent of the particular facts in a particular case, then courts will be able to make those judgments on their own.                                                                                                                                                                             |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Exception 2: DF created the danger**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **[Restatement Â§ 39: Prior Conduct Creating a Risk]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| When an actor\'s prior conduct, even though not tortious, creates a continuing risk of physical harm of a **type characteristic of the conduct**, the actor has a duty to exercise reasonable care to prevent or minimize the harm.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Requires match between type of conduct and harm.                                                                                                                                     | - Ahmed's sugar can case: Ahmed lends sugar to a neighbor. The sugar turns out to be infested with bugs, but Ahmed doesn't know that at the time. A few days later, Ahmed uses the sugar himself and figured out that there are bugs. He doesn't tell the neighbor, who makes bug-infested cookies and gets sick.                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - **YES duty to tell the neighbor, because of the CONTINUING risk. Once the actor did the conduct, the duty continues.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - **This was the risk of harm of a type characteristic of the conduct**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - Look for RISKY BEHAVIOR, not normal behavior                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |   - *Harper:* A boat in shallow water **does not create risk of physical harm**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| What if no tortious conduct created the danger? Duty anyway!                                                                                                                         | **TRUCKING EXAMPLE:** Defendants truck stall out on any icy highway, blocking the road. (Not due to negligence, just icy conditions.) Some cars went down the hill. By the time the driver saw the trucks, he could not stop the car and there was a collision. Plaintiff (Cars) argue that the defendants had an affirmatively duty to put a sign at the top of the hill. |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - Court: Yes, truck drivers DID have a duty because they created the danger. **Once they created the danger, even if they had done nothing up to that point, they had a duty to take precautions necessary to prevent foreseeable injury.** (RST Â§39)                                                                                                                      |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Exception 3: Taking charge of a helpless person**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [**Restatement Â§ 324**: Duty of One Who Takes Charge of Another]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| One who, being under no duty to do so, takes charge of another who is **helpless** adequately to aid or protect himself is subject to liability to the other for any bodily harm caused to him by                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| a)  the failure of the actor to exercise **reasonable care to secure the safety** of the other while within the actor's charge, or                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| b)  the actor's **discontinuing his aid or protection**, if by so doing he leaves the other in a worse position than when the actor took charge of him.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***a)***                                                                                                                                                                       | ***Harper*** probably should have been decided on these grounds.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ##### ***FAILURE TO SECURE SAFETY WHILE IN ACTOR'S CHARGE***                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | ***Zelenka**:* Shopper falls ill in defendant's store. Defendant says he'll take care of the shopper and puts him in an infirmary for 6 hours without medication. Because shopper was in the defendant's infirmary, no one else could help the plaintiff or knew that plaintiff needed help, and plaintiff dies. Defendant is liable.                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | B is already injured when A picks them up to drive them to the hospital. A crashes and B's injuries get exacerbated. A is liable for the harms that get exacerbated by the collision. Defendant is liable.                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | ***Farwell*** could have been decided on these grounds.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***b)***                                                                                                                                                                       | ***Farwell*** could have been decided on these grounds.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ##### ***DISCONTINUING AID***                                                                                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      +----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | B is injured when A picks them up to drive them to the hospital. Partway through the drive, A decides they don't have time to go all the way to the hospital, so they drop B off halfway to the hospital. It takes B longer to find a new ride from the halfway point and the injuries get worse in that time. Defendant is liable.                                        |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Exception 4: Preventing assistance from a third party**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **[Restatement Â§ 327: Negligently Preventing Assistance]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| One who knows or has reason to know that a third person is giving or is ready to give to another aid necessary to prevent physical harm to him, and negligently prevents or disables the third person from giving such aid, is subject to liability for physical harm caused to the other by the absence of the aid which he has prevented the third person from giving.                                                                                                                                                                                          |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| #####                                                                                                                                                                                | E.g., I am a truck driver and I know that there is a fire at a home. I park on top of the hose that the fire department was about to use to the put out the fire. The fire spreads and burns the house.                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - YES to not prevent the receipt of aid                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### 2. Duties Arising from the Occupation of Land

+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **2. Duties Arising from the Occupation of Land**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| **Duties To Others \[UNSETTLED LAW/SPLIT\]**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

| **1. \[TRADITIONAL\] Tripartite approach *(24 states)***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|   ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|   A. Invitee (economic benefits)             DUTY OF REASONABLE CARE (reasonable care to make premises safe)                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|   ------------------------------------------ --------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|   B. Licensee (social guests, no benefits)   DUTY TO WARN OF HIDDEN DANGERS (must not willfully/wantonly/recklessly injure)                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|   C. Trespasser (not allowed in)             NO DUTY (just must not willfully/wantonly/recklessly injure)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|   ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***United Zinc & Chemical Co. v. Britt***                                                                  | **Facts:** D owns land w/ acid pit in basement that has water that looks inviting.                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| (poisonous pool)                                                                                           | - 120 ft from any public roads. 8 & 11 y/os come through the land, jump in, and die                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            | **Holding (Holmes):** Applies traditional tripartite approach. **The children are TRESPASSERS, so there is NO DUTY. No breach of this minimal duty and landowner is NOT LIABLE.**                                            |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            | - **Could have come out differently if:**                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |   - 1\. If water had bordered a road, or                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |   - 2\. If children knew that others went onto the land to access the water                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |     - \[either of these could move the children to licensees\]                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            | - **Different result if applying the RESTATEMENT**                                                                                                                                                                           |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| HYPO: Someone walks onto my property, slips in liquid, and breaks his elbow.                               | A.  Invitee (contractors/business parters): Duty of reasonable care to keep premises safe                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |     a.  Ask whether the puddle being there was a failure of your reasonable care                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |     b.  What if you invite a contractor to your house and there is a puddle on the path they have to travel to enter                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |         i.  *Invitee is not "friends" -- it's people who there is an economic dealing with, like contractors/business partners!*                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            | B.  Licensee (houseguests): Duty to warn of the puddle                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
