|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - THESE ARE NOT EXCLUSIVE!! Other relationships can be included if there is a **relationship of control!!!**                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| What does the duty entail?                                                                                                                                                           | RST Â§ 314A(1)(a) & (b):                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | Take reasonable action:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | 1)  to **protect them against unreasonable risk of physical harm**, and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | 2)  to **give them first aid** after it knows or has reason to know that they are ill or injured, and to care for them until they can be cared for by others.                                                                                                                                                                          |

|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - [Police forces are not equipped to patrol private property]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                      | - Not unfair because these rules do not make them insurers                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |

# Modern Strict Liability 

+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Strict Liability                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ALTERNATIVE TO NEGLIGENCE FOR NON-INTENTIONAL TORTS                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+:==========================================================================================================:+:==========================================================================================================:+:==============================================================================================================================================:+
| Strict liability only cares about RISK & OUTCOME, not level of care.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Strict liability does not care about the level of care that DF took; it only cares about the risks that DF imposed and the outcome.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Torts =                                                                                                    | **Default = Negligence**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| A **sea of negligence** w/ **islands of strict liability**                                                 | **Islands:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            | 1.  Vicarious liability -- respondeat superior                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            | 2.  Wild/abnormally dangerous animals                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            | 3.  Abnormally dangerous activities                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            | 4.  Products liability                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Strict liability                                                                                           | You did something dangerous and followed ALLL THE RELEVANT SAFETY PROCOLS -- but you are still liable if someone gets hurt.                                                                                                                                 |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Rylands v. Fletcher***                                                                                  | **DF was not negligent. Should the court hold him liable?**                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| (Reservoir drowning neighbor's mine)                                                                       | 1.  **[Writ system:]{.underline}** Depends on trespass (direct, strict liability) vs. trespass on the case (indirect, negligence).                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            | 2.  **[Appellate court]{.underline}**: Even though the harm is indirect, and DF is not negligent, DF should be strictly liable                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |     a.  DF, for his own purposes, keeps something that will be dangerous if it escapes.                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |     b.  No ground to say PL took any risk; he is really minding his own business. PL could not manage or control the risk.                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            | 3.  **[Highest court:]{.underline}** Distinguish between natural and nonnatural uses of land.                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |     a.  If natural (e.g. having a river), no liability                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |     b.  If nonnatural (e.g. building a dam) and causes harm, strict liability                                                                                                                                                                               |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Negligence vs. Strict Liability**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Negligence**                                                                                                                                                                                                          | **Strict Liability**                                                                                                                           |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| - Holding D liable for harms caused by his action **only if they failed to take an adequate level of care**                                                                                                             | - D liable for harms caused by his action **irrespective of level of care**                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                |
| - If there is fault, then liability, otherwise let the harms lie where they fall                                                                                                                                        | - If harm arises someone has to pay, so it is better to make the person who acted/caused it/assumed the risk pay                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                |
| - Who decides the standard of care and what about harms where nobody is at fault but there is an external reason to hold one party liable?                                                                              | - There is *always* action in some sense by both parties -- who assumed the risk and why intervene to allocate costs to an innocent party?     |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Arguments for Negligence**                                                                                                                                                                                            | **Arguments for strict liability**                                                                                                             |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| - [Consequentialist case:]{.underline} SL stymies economic growth and development by making innovators cautious and negligence has better balance by incentivizing care while protecting against faultless liability    | - [Consequentialist case:]{.underline} SL forces the internalization of externalities resulting from one\'s actions, which benefits society    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                |
| - [Corrective justice case:]{.underline} D should only pay for costs to P if they are at fault; if faultless it is wrong to intervene and shift costs                                                                   | - [Corrective justice case:]{.underline} the one who causes the harm is \"less innocent\" or in some sense consented, and therefore should pay |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Affirmative defense to strict liability:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| Assumption of risk (PL contributed to the situation in a way that's so wrongful that it's unfair to hold DF liable.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 1\. Contributory & comparative negligence:                                                                 | NOT a defense to strict liability, except if PL's contributory negligence consists of knowingly and unreasonably subjecting themselves to the abnormally dangerous activity. See Animals [Â§515]{.underline} below.                                          |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 2\. Assumption of risk:                                                                                    | 1.  **Primary and secondary assumption of risk.**                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| If assumed the risk, completely barred from recovery.                                                      |     1.  [Primary:]{.underline} DF didnt do anything wrong; just chose to enter risky activity.                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |     2.  [Secondary:]{.underline} DF is negligent.                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |         - Secondary assumption of risk is basically equivalent to contributory negligence, except that DF will have no liability at all!                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                            +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                            | 2.  **Implicit v. explicit assumption of risk:**                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                            |     1.  whether there's contract. ***Tunkl*** factors.                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

## Animals 

+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Animals                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |

| RST Â§22: Wild Animals                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| 1)  An owner or possessor of a wild animal is subject to **strict liability** for physical harm caused by the wild animal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| 2)  A wild animal is an animal that belongs to a category of animals that have **not been generally domesticated and that are likely, unless restrained, to cause personal injury**                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                   | - A BEAR OR A WOLF: (1) Not generally domesticated and (2) Likely to cause personal injury                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   |   - Liable whether or not the owner knows of this animal's propensity to cause harm                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   |   - E.g., You have a wolf that has always been a gentleman. But then one day he injures your friend. Saying "I have never known him to do this before" is not a defense.                                                                                           |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                   | - Rationale for Strict Liability instead of negligence: Some animals have such intrinsic risk that there is no reasonable level of care                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   | - Unilateral---rather than reciprocal---risk in owning this animal                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| RST Â§23: Abnormally Dangerous Animals                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| An owner or possessor of an animal that the owner or possessor knows or has reason to know has **dangerous tendencies abnormal for the animal's category** is subject to strict liability for physical harm caused by the animal if the **[harm ensues from that dangerous tendency.]{.underline}**                                                                    |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Domestic animals?**                                                                             | Apply NEGLIGENCE (was the owner negligent vis-Ã -vis their chicken?) for DOMESTICATED ANIMALS (chickens, cats, etc.)                                                                                                                                                |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **EXCEPTION:**                                                                                    | Apply STRICT LIABILITY if the animal is VICIOUS FOR ITS CATEGORY                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
| **Abnormal for category**                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                   | Dealing with a particularly aggressive domesticated animal                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   | - E.g., Horses are dangerous as a category, but we still need to live with them, so strict liability only applies when a horse is abnormally dangerous.                                                                                                            |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Rationale**                                                                                     | Humans have developed certain relationships with animals that have become standard and fruitful for society as a whole. Want to leave it open for us to keep engaging with them without a level of legal liability that makes it hazardous                         |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   | - Difference between owning a chicken (social benefit - negligence) and owning a tiger (no social benefit)                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   | - Certain things are useful despite their risks.                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                   |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                   |   - If we make the legal liability level so high, we might end up with a suboptimal level                                                                                                                                                                          |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
