## Ultrahazardous Activities

+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Ultrahazardous Activities                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| [Overview:]{.underline} Those performing abnormally dangerous activities are liable for harms despite exercise of utmost care, though liability is limited to the kind of harm made dangerous by the activity.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - **Dangerousness factors:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|   - Existence of high degree of risk of some harm to person/land/chattel; likelihood that harm will be great; inability to eliminate risk w/ reasonable care; extent to which common activity; inappropriateness of activity to place where it happens; extent to which value to community outweighed by danger                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| - **RST:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|   - 1\) foreseeable/highly significant risk of harm even w/ care + 2) NOT common usage (driving)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| [RST Â§519: General Principle]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| \(1\) One who carries on an **abnormally dangerous activity** is subject to liability for harm to the person, land or chattels of another resulting from the activity, **although he has exercised the utmost care** to prevent the harm. \[STRICT LIABILITY -- EVEN IF YOU DO YOUR BEST, SOME ACTIVITIES ARE TOO DANGEROUS\]                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***Spano v. Perini***                                                                                                                                     | **Facts:** P owns Brooklyn garage which was damaged by construction blast 125 ft away. There was no negligence from Ps.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| ##### (explosion under car repair)                                                                                                                              | **Holding:** When you perform ultra-hazardous activities, and it causes harm, then regardless of reasonable precautions, you're strictly liable. Blasting is obviously ultrahazardous.                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Before *Spano: Booth* holds that you need proof of negligence to hold construction company liable for blasting damage, unless there was actual invasion of the defendant's property.                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - If *Booth* applies in this case, there would not be liability: No trespass onto property and yes reasonable care.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - *Spano:* Overrules *Booth* and applies strict liability, aka liability without fault                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | **Rationale:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Incentivizing: if profit is still more than the cost, do it; otherwise stop.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - [Efficiency]{.underline} concern -- if profits don't make up for the liability, the defendant won't do it, and society will benefit because there won't be a net loss of benefit. If the ultrahazardous activity continues, the person who bears the cost when things go wrong will be the real estate company/construction company/etc. who is benefitting from that. |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Conflicting rights: right to undisturbed possession; right to lawful enjoyment of property. The former must prevail.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Why apply strict liability instead of negligence?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - Inherently dangerous to blow stuff up! Even if it is towards a productive cause, it remains inherently dangerous, and the defendant is the one making a profit off of it.                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - Presuming negligence is not enough: DF might still get away.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Narrow ***Spano*** takeaway: BLASTING ROCKS                                                                                                                     | In blasting cases, it doesn't matter whether the harm is from the movement of the air (no direct invasion as previously required under *Booth)* or from a rock that enters the property. As long as you can show that the blasting caused the harm, there is liability.                                                                                                    |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Broad ***Spano*** takeaway:                                                                                                                                     | Analogize to other ultrahazarous *Spano*-like activities that are inherently dangerous and destructive the same way that explosions are.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| DANGEROUS ACTIVITIES                                                                                                                                            |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **(2)*\[CAVEAT\]* This strict liability is limited to the [kind of harm]{.underline}, the possibility of which makes the activity abnormally dangerous.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Example**                                                                                                                                                     | Looks like proximate cause and per se negligence and plaintiff's conduct for strict liability!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Blasts must create a blast-related harm                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - [Blast related harm]{.underline} = E.g., dust damage or structural damage to property, or hearing damage                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - [Non-blast related harm]{.underline} = Dynamite work in your neighborhood creates nostalgic recollections of third grade and your therapy bills go up                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Mink farm hypo (Madson v. East Jordan):***                                                                                                                   | [Guy does not know of mink farm nearby, and blasts dynamite to do construction in a rural district. Frightens mink and mink kills mink baby.]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Is fright the kind of harm that makes activity dangerous?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - DF would argue: No. Should instead ask negligence.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |   - PL would argue: Of course an explosion scares people/animals                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | - Characterizing kind of harm, analogous to proximate cause.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **2nd RST Â§520 \[CONTROLLING\]:**                                                                                                                               | *[In determining whether an activity is abnormally dangerous, consider the following factors:]{.underline}*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| **DANGEROUSNESS FACTORS FOR ABNORMALLY DANGEROUS ACTIVITIES**                                                                                                   | a)  existence of **a high degree of risk** of some harm to the person, land or chattels of others;                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | b)  likelihood that the **harm** that results from it will be great;                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | c)  **inability to eliminate** the risk by the exercise of reasonable care;                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | d)  extent to which the activity is **not a matter of common usage;**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | e)  **inappropriateness** of the activity to the place where it is carried on; and                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                 | f)  extent to which its **value** to the community is **outweighed** by its dangerous attributes.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

## Affirmative Defenses

+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| RST Â§515: Plaintiff\'s Conduct (How to think about affirmative defenses based on plaintiff's conduct when the liability is based on strict liability?)                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |

| \(1\) Except as stated in Subsection (2), the **contributory negligence of the plaintiff is NOT a defense** to the strict liability of the possessor of an animal.                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NO DEFENSE IF PL JUST BEING AN AIRHEAD                                                                                                                                                                  | - E.g. No contributory negligence defense if you let a snake out and someone doesn't see it, or if the escaped mastiff bites someone who was being an airhead.            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                         +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                         | - Rationale: CONCEPTUAL TENSION TO CONSIDERING PLAINTIFF CONDUCT                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                         |   - How strict is strict liability if the plaintiff's conduct matters?? The whole point is that we don't care how careful you were -- why should we care about plaintiff. |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| \(2\) The plaintiff's contributory negligence in **knowingly and unreasonably subjecting** himself to the risk that a wild animal or an abnormally dangerous domestic animal will do harm to his person, land or chattels, is a defense to the strict liability.                                                                                                                    |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| YES, DEFENSE IF PL ACTING KNOWINGLY/ UNREASONABLY                                                                                                                                                       | - E.g. Yes contributory negligence defense if the plaintiff had picked a fight with a bear or hit the mastiff with a stick on purpose                                     |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| \(3\) The plaintiff\'s **assumption of the risk of harm from the animal IS a defense** to the strict liability.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| YES, DEFENSE IF ASSUMED RISK                                                                                                                                                                            | - E.g. you signed to enter a fight with a bear or jumped into the mastiff pen knowing that he was there.                                                                  |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Summary of affirmative defense to strict liability:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 1\. Contributory & comparative negligence:                                             | NOT a defense to strict liability, **except:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                        | - if PL's contributory negligence consists of knowingly and unreasonably subjecting themselves to the abnormally dangerous activity. See Animals [Â§515]{.underline} below. \[*CONCEPTUALLY THE SAME AS ASSUMPTION OF RISK\]*                                                               |
+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 2\. Assumption of risk:                                                                | 1.  **Primary and secondary assumption of risk.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                        |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
| If assumed the risk, completely barred from recovery.                                  |     1.  [Primary:]{.underline} DF didnt do anything wrong; just chose to enter risky activity.                                                                                                                                                                                             |

[Secondary:]{.underline} DF is negligent.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

## Vicarious Liability 

+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Vicarious Liability: Respondeat Superior                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |

| ***Respondeat superior**:* An employer is liable for an employee's damage when it was **foreseeable that the damage could have been caused in the scope of employment, even if the employee was not performing a duty for the employer**.                                                                                                                    |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **CLAIM 1:**                                                                                                          | 1)  **Did the employee do something negligent?**                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Respondeat Superior**                                                                                               |     (a) Negligence? (Duty/Breach/Causation/Damages)                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **Analysis**                                                                                                          |     (b) Strict liability (i.e., if you are a zoo and they are handling a tiger)                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |     (c) Intentional tort                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                       +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                       | 2)  **Can we hold the employer liable for the employee's negligent behavior? TEST: Was in the scope of employment? 4 questions**                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | <!-- -->                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | 1.  Was the injury that the employee caused **characteristic of the employer's activities? (*Bushey)***                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | 2.  Was the employee\'s conduct **subject to the employer\'s control** (i.e., did it happen during work hours)?                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | 3.  Was the act **work-related**, either in fact or in employee\'s head (incorporates subjective test from ***Nelson**)*?                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | 4.  If not work-related, how big a **deviation** (employers could still be liable for a small deviation from work conduct)                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | **\_**                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **CLAIM 2:**                                                                                                          | 1.  **Could use ordinary negligence tools (D/B/C/D) to argue that employer was negligent in HIRING employer**                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
| **NEGLIGENCE IN HIRING**                                                                                              |     i)  NOT if it was a one-off error -- must look for a more generalized notion of negligence                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |         a.  Not qualified in the first place or a pattern of behavior                                                                                                                                                                |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Ira S. Bushey & Sons v. US***                                                                                      | **Facts:** Drunk US Coast Guard man comes home late and turns wheels on drydock walls which lifts a Coast Guard ship and hit the wall. US Gov\'t pays drydock but says acts committed outside **[scope of employment.]{.underline}** |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | **Holding (Respondeat superior):** Certain accidents/injuries are characteristic of an enterprise, so strict liability is NOT unfair since the accident was *foreseeable.*                                                           |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Scope of employment test**                                                                                          | **IF ACTIVITY IS IN THE SCOPE OF EMPLOYMENT: EMPLOYER IS STRICTLY LIABLE**                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                       +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                       | **[Subjective motive/purpose test?]{.underline} NO.**                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | **Objective foreseeability test? YES.**                                                                                                                                                                                              |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Rationale for respondeat superior/vicarious liability:**                                                            | Judge Friendly **rejects** the economic rationale for respondeat superior                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                       +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                       | Instead, Friendly says the rationale is: **certain harms are characteristic of an industry** *(here, the type of harm was characteristic of running a ship -- but setting fire to the bar probably wouldn't)*                        |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | - These risks are part of what makes the enterprise profitable in the first place!                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       | - Such accidents are foreseeable to the enterprise: The business is in the best place to take preventative measures and spread the loss                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |   - Incentive to control bad employee behavior                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |   - Puts liability on actor that can spread the loss to parties benefiting from activity                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                       |   - Fairness = no windfall for employer or unfair costs on innocent party                                                                                                                                                            |

| 1\. Wright*** \[not tested this year\]: "Unless we confine the operations to the parties who entered them, the most absurd and outrageous consequences would ensue."                                                                                                                                                                                                      |

| 2\. Buick* (Extinguishes the privity rule!!)]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |

|                                                                    | - \[WHEEL MANUFACTURER (DEFECT) ðŸ¡ª CAR MANUFACTURER (DID NOT INSPECT) ðŸ¡ªRETAILER (ONLY ONE IN PRIVITY W PLAINTIFF) ðŸ¡ªPLAINTIFF (INJURED BY WHEEL)\]                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                    | - There was an accident due to defective wood in wheel, but the wheel was made by a 3rd party. D would have known w/ \"reasonable inspection.\" Claiming negligence, not fraud or willful concealment                                                                                                                                                                                      |

|                                                                    |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

|                                                                    |       - Coffee urn: When the urn was being used for the things it is supposed to be used for, it became such a source of great danger if not carefully constructed                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
