| It may be **inferred** that the harm sustained by the plaintiff was caused by a product defect existing at the time of sale or distribution, without proof of a specific defect, when [the incident that harmed the plaintiff]{.underline} \[**Two prongs\]**:                                                                |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| > **(a) accident was of a kind that ordinarily occurs as a result of product defect** (product [fails to perform its manifestly intended function)]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                               |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| > **(b) \[exclude all other causes\] accident was not, in the particular case, solely the result of causes other than product defect** existing at the time of sale or distribution.                                                                                                                                          |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***Speller v. Sears***                                                                                                    | **[FACTS]{.underline}**: Fridge fire, circumstantial evidence. Clearly manufacturing defect claim, challenge is evidence of defect.                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - P's wife and son died in house fire originating in the kitchen                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   i)  P claims fire started by defective wiring in fridge, although wiring destroyed in fire                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   ii) D Sears is retailer of the fridge + D Whirlpool is the manufacturer, and Ds claim fire started from stove-top grease + produce Fire Marshall's report saying as much                  |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   iii) P produced expert opinions supporting P's theory and questioning Fire Marshall's                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - Appellate Court granted D's motion for summary judgment                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | **[HOLDING]{.underline}**: Circumstantial evidence is acceptable. Inferring:                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | (1) there was a defect;                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | (2) when the defect came into being;                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | (3) the defect was a factual cause.                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - **P may prove manufacturing defect circumstantially by** \[LIKE RES IPSA LOQUITOR -- HARM OF THE KIND THAT DOESN'T HAPPEN W/O NEGLIGIGENCE\]                                              |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   a)  **proving the product did not perform as intended &**                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   b)  **excluding all other possible causes**                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - **Court: given these circumstances, we are allowing an evidentiary inference**                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   i)  **RES IPSA: Allow INFERENCE OF NEGLIGENCE & defendant's conduct was primary cause of this harm**                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 |   ii) **HERE: INFERENCE OF DEFECT & when that defect came into being**                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - D argues that P failed to meet 2nd prong, and that the fire was started by grease that caught on fire by the stove, as Fire Marshall concluded                                            |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - But court notes that P does introduce evidence on this Q: expert testimonies + an affidavit rejecting D's theory and Fire Marshall's conclusion                                           |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | - Even if we doubt that P has enough evidence to meet 2nd prong, court says evidence provided raises a triable issue of fact, and so SJ was not appropriate                                 |
|                                                                                                                                 |                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                 | NOT res ipsa -- that's for proving breach in negligence.                                                                                                                                    |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

### Design Defects 

+----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Design Defect                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

| Restatement (3d.) (Products Liability) Â§ 2 (b) (RST): when **the foreseeable risks of harm posed by the product could have been reduced or avoided by the adoption of a reasonable alternative design \[RAD\]** by the seller or other distributor, or a predecessor in the commercial chain of distribution, and the omission of the alternative design renders the product not reasonably safe                                                                                                               |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Reasonable Alternative Design                                                                                                                                                                    | - Negligence-like: consider foreseeability and reasonableness.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   - For exam, alternative design will be easy to come up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - The product, as designed, is needlessly dangerous                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   - Historical context: industrial revolution, car manufacturers always argue drivers are negligent.                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ***Barker v. Lull Engineering***                                                                                                                                                                 | **[FACTS:]{.underline}** Loader injury, design defect test.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| Combination of cost benefit and reasonable altenatives                                                                                                                                           | - P (substitute driver) used high-lift loader manufactured by D. As P lifted lumber 18 feet on uneven ground, P tried to compensate for slope by manipulating the forks on the base of the load. P lost control of loader, tried to jump away, and then was struck and seriously injured by falling lumber. |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - Jury found for D                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   - PL: no seat belt, no stabilizer etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   - DF: seat belt would make loader more dangerous; PL misused \[causation\].                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | [**TWO TESTS:** (]{.underline}For this course, use risk-utility test as main approach, and consider consumer expectations as relevant)                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | (1) **Consumer expectations test:** When product has failed to perform as safely as ordinary consumer would expect when product is used in intended or reasonably foreseeable manner.                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     a.  *Reasonably foreseeable: E.g., a pan can also be used as a meat tenderizer and that is a foreseeable use too (not baseball)*                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     b.  Objection: customer is not in a good position to know about the risks of a product.                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     c.  In this case, PL probably cannot recover under this test because the loader met consumer's expectations.                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | (2) **Risk-utility test \[MORE INFLUENTIAL\]:** Product also has a design defect if **benefits don\'t outweigh design's risk of danger**. Factors:                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     a.  Gravity of such a danger posed by challenged design                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     b.  the likelihood that such a danger would occur                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     c.  the mechanical feasibility of a safer alternative design                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     d.  the financial cost of an improved design                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     e.  the adverse consequences to the product and to the consumer that would result from an alternative design                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | **[HOLDING:]{.underline}** Jury instruction erroneous b/c said that 1) P must prove loader more dangerous than average consumer would expect, excluding risk/utility test; and 2) must evaluate defectiveness re: product's intended rather than reasonably foreseeable use                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - **Instead, design defect if violates *[either]{.underline}* consumer expectations test *[OR]{.underline}* risk/utility test in light of reasonably foreseeable uses (and not just intended ones)**                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   a)  **[PLAINTIFF'S CHOICE!!!! \^\^]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   b)  consumer expectations inadequate because might not know about reasonable alternative designs                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Defenses to Design Defect Claim (None of these are conclusive but are factors that might tip in favor of DF.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 1\. OBVIOUS                                                                                                                                                                                      | 1\. Point to the fact that the design defect in question was open and obviousÂ                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - How could this have been a design defect - it's not concealed, you knew it was a feature of the product                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 2\. COMPLIANT                                                                                                                                                                                    | 2.Â This feature is compliant with the state of the art                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - Not conclusive, but will heavily weight in favor of the defendantÂ                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 3\. CAUSATION                                                                                                                                                                                    | 3.Â Misuse or modification of the product -- goes to causation (***Liriano*** below)                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - Fact that will preclude liability in many situations but not all                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  | - For instance, will not help ifÂ                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   - The misuse or modification did not cause the injuryÂ                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                  |   - When the actual modification of the product that caused the injury was foreseeable to the defendant. (***Liriano II***)                                                                                                                                                                                 |

### Warning Defects 

+--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Warning Defects                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

| Restatement (3d.) (Products Liability) Â§ 2 (c) (RST): When the **[foreseeable risks]{.underline}** of harm posed by the product could have been **[reduced or avoided by the provision of reasonable instructions or warnings]{.underline}** by the seller or other distributor, or a predecessor in the commercial chain of distribution, and the **omission of the instructions or warnings renders the product not reasonably safe.**                                                         |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                | - Negligence-like, like design defect: There is a general duty of care to all people who will foreseeably come into contact with the product and be harmed by it.                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Potency of things like cancer treatment and other things -- don't want to change the DESIGN because that would affect its efficacy.                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***Liriano v. Hobart***                                                                                                                  | **Facts:** P caught right hand + lower arm in commercial meat grinding machine, resulting in amputation                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ##### (meat grinder, safety guard removed)                                                                                                     | - His employer had removed the safety guard form the machine                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Expansive picture of warnings -- includes offering option of alternative way of using product!                                                 | - The meat grinder was manufactured and sold by Hobart Corp. in 1961                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - At time of the sale, grinder had an affixed safety guard, but included no warnings on machine or otherwise to indicate that it was dangerous to operate the machine without the safety guard in place                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Hobart later learned that a significant number of purchasers of its meat grinders had removed the safety guards, and began issuing warnings on its meat grinders concerning removal of the safety guard in 1962                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                | **II:**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 1.  Manufacturer may be liable for design defect for foreseeable misuses;                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 2.  There is duty to warn if it is foreseeable to the manufacturers that someone may misuse their product.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 3.  The duty extends even after product has been sold, since manufacturers are in good position to discover defects (customers would tell them) and warn customers.                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                | **III (Calabresi):**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 1.  **\[OBVIOUSNESS\]: [As a matter of law, is the danger so obvious that \[as a matter of law\] warning is not required? (Danger of operating unguarded grinder.)]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |     a)  No. Whether danger is obvious depends on the user, and users vary. Also, people who recognize the danger may not be able to avoid it (safely operate grinder without shield).                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |         (1) **Steep hill warning hypo: Functions of warning -- OFFERING AN ALTERNATIVE OPTION THAT CONSUMER DID'NT KNOW**                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |             (i) Warning is not only about existence of danger, but also gives context and safer alternatives.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |                 1.  Court wants to incentivize latter kinds.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |                 2.  It is obvious by looking that the thing is dangerous...but it is not obvious by looking that there is another option -- that is the function of a warning that does more than point out obvious danger!                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |         (2) In evaluating a warning, factfinder should consider multiple possible functions of warnings + foreseeable variability in product users.                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |             (i) Even if dangerousness of product is open & obvious + warning not required as to that face (e.g., meat grinder), warnings can also provide info on how to minimize danger/risk of harm (e.g., encourage use of safety guard), such that failure to include this info can constitute a warning defect under risk/utility test     |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 2.  **\[CAUSATION\]: [As a matter of law, does warning claim fail at causation because of the lack of evidence about the connection between lack of warning and injury?]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |     a)  No. Failure to warn increases chances of harm. (Think ***Zuchowicz***.)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |         i)  **Causation:** *Zuchowicz* approach to warning defects: P's showing that D;s failure to warn greatly increased likelihood of harm = sufficient for jury to find that warning defect caused P's injury + shift burden to D for rebuttal/evidence to the contrary (which it did not provide)                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |     b)  **Heeding Presumption: Once there has been a showing that a warning was inadequate, juries are entitled to presume that, had there been adequate warning, the plaintiff would have heeded the danger.**                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |         i)  DF can still rebut the presumption, e.g. by arguing that this DF would have disregarded the warning, like if they have a history of being careless even if they had the best warning manual ever                                                                                                                                    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                | [LIRIANO OVERVIEW -- 2 POINTS]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 1.  EXPANSIVE DEFINITION OF WARNINGS AND THEIR FUNCTION: Fact-finder should consider MULTIPLE FUNCTIONS OF WARNINGS and VARIABILITY OF PRODUCT USER (people unfamiliar with the product, people of different languages, etc.)                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | 2.  HEEDING PRESUMPTION: **Once there has been a showing that a warning was inadequate, juries are entitled to presume that, had there been adequate warning, the plaintiff would have heeded the danger.**                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |     a)  **But for the absence of the warning, the plaintiff would have followed instructions safely and not gotten injured**                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
