|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |     b)  **Heeding presumption goes under BUT-FOR CAUSATION**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| #####                                                                                                                                          | **[FACTS]{.underline}**: Clear, unmistakable, prominent; 7 notices; 2 mention serious injury. Detaching guard is extremely rare.                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
| ##### ***Hood v. Ryobi*** (saw blade falling)                                                                                                  | - P purchased miter saw made by D, which had a metal upper guard and plastic lower guard that retracted when she came into contact with wood                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - P believed guards blocked blade from wood he wanted to cut, so he removed them: he detached the saw blade, unscrewed the 4 screws holding the guards to the frame, and then replaced the blade.                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - P then cut through the piece of wood and continued working with the saw, and after around 20 mins, the blade flew off the saw and back towards P, partially amputated his thumb and lacerating his right leg                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Product had many warnings about the dangers of removing the guards: 3 on saw itself + 4 on owner's manual                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | **[TEST]{.underline}: Whether benefits of more detailed warning outweigh the costs of requiring the change.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Encyclopedic warning is not required: The costs of the change is that more details will dilute the warning, undermine the effectiveness of warning -- too wordy to read and too technical to understand                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   i)  **No need for an "encyclopedic warning" but rather one reasonable under the circumstances: test is whether benefits of more detail would outweigh the costs**                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |       (a) Here, D's warnings were clear + numerous, explicitly saying not to operate w/out blade guards + noting that "serious injury" could result                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |       (b) Most users did not remove guards, suggesting adequate warning                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - **Warning should be reasonable under the circumstances;** clarity and forcefulness.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Factors:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   a)  **(1) scope of the danger;**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   b)  **(2) extent of seriousness;**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   c)  **(3) means to convey, including location of warning;**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   d)  **(4) context like advertising;**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   e)  **(5) foreseeable user.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| #####                                                                                                                                          | [TAKEAWAY 1: Warning defects law does not demand an encyclopedic warning]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Would additional detail diminish communicative value?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | [TAKEAWAY 2: The warning should contain a fair description of the nature and extent of the danger to the mind of a reasonably prudent person]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                       |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Can't be too general -- "serious injury" is probably enough, though                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Needs to be clear enough about the nature of the risk -- not just an upset stomach but suffocation?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                |   - Make plausible arguments about WHY a warning is inadequate. Imagine a warning sign on a child's motorbike that says no passengers but doesn't indicate that there is a risk of *serious* injury from *burns.*                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Ask not only about the clarity of the warning but its forcefulness -- serious injury could be conveyed with a diagram or color or font                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Ask if the warning seems inconsistent with how the product has been advertised. If you have a mismatch, that inconsistency can cut against the power of a warning. What's the point of such a warning if you are advertising to people to whom it would be dangerous in the first place.                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Placement on the warning -- on the bottom of a bike cushion instead of on the handlebars?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - Foreseeable user -- what is the education level, and is the warning catering only to people with PhDs in chemistry? If the targeted demographic speaks a second language or includes children, the warning should reflect that.                                                                                                               |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| #####                                                                                                                                          | **[DO NOT DO A SEPARATE NEGLIGENCE ANALYSIS FOR PRODUCTS]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | - **[TORT CLAIMS FOCUSED ON A PRODUCT OR SELLER OF A GOOD AND ACTIONS VIS-Ã€-VIS THE GOOD]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                | **[ONLY MAKE PRODUCTS LIABILITY CLAIMS!!! NO SEPARATE NEGLIGENCE ANALYSIS CONNECTED TO THOSE CLAIMS.]{.underline}**                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| #####                                                                                                                                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Steps of Warning Default Analysis                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **1. First, evaluate the defect.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | a)  Consider the multiple functions of warning: existence of danger, context, safer alternatives.                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | b)  Take into account foreseeable variability of users.                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |     i)  Even though grinder is obviously dangerous, jury will consider type of person (young, inexperienced, etc.)                                                     |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **2. Then evaluate causation.**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | c)  The Heeding Presumption in favor of PL: but for lack of warning, PL would have heeded.                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                        |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | d)  The presumption is rebuttable.                                                                                                                                     |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                                                                                                                        |
+-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

## Steps of Product Liability Analysis 

+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Products Liability Analysis                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |

| 1.  **DUTY:** Don't worry about it at all. Assume that there are duties.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     i)  **NO DUTY EXCEPTIONS (unlikely to test):**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (1) [**Obvious danger in a warning defect context:**]{.underline} In response to a warning defect claim, a manufacturer might say that they did not have a duty because the danger was so obvious/blatant that they did not have a duty. E.g., including a warning on a lighter that fire can burn you.                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (2) **[*Palsgraf* Problem of Unforeseeable Victim:]{.underline}** Victim being unforeseeable can render there being no duty                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|             (a) Unforeseeable victim is a global concept in tort law than can apply in any liability regime to quash liability                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (3) [*Palsgraf* Problem as No Proximate Cause:]{.underline} This particular danger was so unforeseeable that I had no duty to warn you.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (4) [*Learned-*Intermediary Exception]{.underline}                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 2.  **BREACH (most of the products liability analysis):** Asking, is there a manufacturing defect? Is there a design defect? Is there a warning defect? Breach question is asking whether there is a defect and applying the test and coming to a conclusion.                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     a)  **Design defects -- *Barker Rule***                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     b)  **Manufacturing defect -- RST**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         i)  Etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     c)  **Defect:** Which type?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (1) DIRECT EVIDENCE?                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (2) CIRCUMSTANTIAL EVIDENCE? (like res ipsa -- would not occur in the absence of a defect)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 3.  **Causation:** Want to know that the DEFECT CAUSED THE INJURY (look out for product modifications or misuses that would make it unfair to hold manufacturer responsible                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     (1) **BUT FOR CAUSATION:** Usually evident that but-for the manufacturing defect, the oven would not have exploded.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (a) One place where you might need more: **HEEDING PRESUMPTION IN A WARNING DEFECT CLAIM CONTEXT**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     (2) **PROXIMATE CAUSE:** Lodestar of analysis for negligence is foreseeability. But here, when thinking about proximate cause in products liability context aka seeing if you have a defective product, ask what *kind of injuries and implicated in what kind of way.*                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (i) Hold defendant responsible only when there is a match between the types of injuries we would expect from a manufacturing defect and the type of injuries that occur                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|             1.  E.g., in *Speller v. Sears,* when fridges malfunction due to wiring, fires are likely to occur and a fire did occur so there is a match. Similarly, defective warnings on a drill probably leads to accidently drilling into finger.                                                                                                                                                                         |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         (ii) Problems with proximate cause:                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|              1.  E.g., tube of mascara that being of a manufacturing defect has an applicator that is too sharp. If the purchaser uses it as a weapon and stabs someone, should the person who has been stabbed be able to sue the manufacturer? No, defect in the production of the mascara leads to a mismatch in type of harm. Would expect cuts on eye by person trying to use it as mascara; would not expect stabbing. |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|              2.  E.g., imagine toaster that frequently burns food too much from a problem. User develops an affinity for charred toast. But then one day chips tooth eating charred toast. NOT the foreseeable type of harm.                                                                                                                                                                                                 |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 4.  **Damages: EGGSHELL SKULL RULE CONTINUES TO APPLY**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|     a)  Applies across negligence/intentional torts/strict liability/products liability, etc.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|         i)  E.g., manufacturing defect cuts someone, but they are hemophiliac and suffer severe damage, more than a minor cut. Responsible for full amount!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| 5.  **Plaintiff's Conduct**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+

## Plaintiff's Conduct 

+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Plaintiff's Conduct                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |

| PL's conduct in product liability: Contributory negligence                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| P's assumption or risk is *not* a complete defense.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| - EXPLAIN WHY PLAINTIFF'S CONDUCT SHOULD BE UNDERSTOOD AT CONTRIBUTORY NEGLIENCE OR ASSUMPTION OF RISK AND DALY APPROACH                                                                                                                                                                                               |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| - SHOULD PLAINTIFF'S CONDUCT FIGURE INTO DUTY PRONG? **USE THE CHART ON COURSEBOOKS AND LISTEN TO CLASS RECORDING FROM 4/24**                                                                                                                                                                                          |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Although the same conduct may be fatal to the claim in other ways:          | - may function as a **superseding cause** (e.g., P altered the product in a way that was totally unforeseeable)                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                             | - may counsel **against a finding of defectiveness** (if the danger is so open and obvious, manufacturer can assume that ppl will guard against the risk)                                                                                |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Both assumption of risk and contributory negligence may reduce recovery\... | - **Except for failure-to-discover latent defects -- not treated as contributory negligence.**                                                                                                                                           |
|                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                             |   - Famous case involving a Mr. Goodbar candy bar. After PL bit into it, he discovered worms and eggs. We don't say that PL was contributorily negligent for failing to discover this defect.                                            |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| ##### ***Daly v. General Motors***                                          | PL argued defective product. But wasn't wearing seatbelt.                                                                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ##### (Car crash, no use seat belt/lock)                                    | Comparative negligence applies to products liability.                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                             | - Traditionally, strict product liability is all or nothing; comparative negligence is by definition not.                                                                                                                                |
|                                                                             |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
|                                                                             | - But no real contradiction. Comparative negligence can reduce damages.                                                                                                                                                                  |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **RESTATEMENT**                                                             | If proof supports a determination of the harm that would have resulted from other causes in the absence of the product defect, the product seller's liability is limited to the increased harm attributable solely to the product defect |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **Policy:**                                                                 | Uphold manufacturer's incentive and accountability, thus protect defenseless victims; also take PL's conduct into account; spread losses throughout society.                                                                             |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| **APPLICATION**                                                             | PLAINTIFF CONDUCT CAN FIGURE INTO MANUFACTURING, WARNING, OR DESIGN DEFECT CASES!                                                                                                                                                        |
+-----------------------------------------------------------------------------+------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
